name: PL 2338/2023
scope: AI suppliers and operators in Brazil; risk-based framework
penalties: Up to R$50M or 2% of annual revenue in Brazil
transparencyRequirements: Disclosure of AI usage and explanation for high-risk outputs

name: Basic Act
scope: AI developers/providers impacting Korea; hight-impact systems
riskClassification: High-impact AI with significant or rights risk
penalties: KWR 30M (~$25K) or 3 years imprisonment ofr violations
transparencyRequirements: Lebeling for generative AI (GenAI); transparency for critical decisions

name: AB 2013
scope: GenAI systems used in California; public-facing
riskClassification: No formal risk tiers; focus on GenAI transparency
penalties: No specified fines; civil lawsuits possible under consumer law
transparencyRequirements: Public posting of training data sources and methodologies

name: SB 24-2-5
scope: High-risk AI for consequential decisions in Colorado
riskClassification: Single category: high-risk AI impacting rights
penalties: Civil penalties; administrative fines up to $100k
transparencyRequirements: Notice to consumers and appeals for adverse decision
smallBusinessExemption: Exempt if <50 exmployees and no proprietary data training

name: TRAIGA
scope: High-risk AI systems used for consequential decisions in Texas
riskClassification: High-risk AI and prohibited uses (e.g. social scoring)
penalties: Fines up to $100K/violation; daily fines for noncompliance
transparencyRequirements: Consumer disclosures and appeal processes for high-risk AI

name: S. 3312
scope: High-impacted and critical impact AI across the US
riskClassification: High-impact AI; critical impact AI (e.g. surveillance)
penalties: Up to $300K or twice the AI's value; deployment bans for violations
transparencyRequirements: Lables for GenAI; risk assessments for high-impact systems
effectiveDate: No yet enacted; earliest obligations 180 days postenactment
enforcementAuthority: Secretary of Commerce; Attorney General for enforcement
smallBusinessExemption: No explicit exemption; scaled by risk

name: EU AI Act
scope: Providers and users of AI in the EU; risk-tier system
riskClassification: Four categories; prohibited, high, limited, minimal risk
penalties: Up to Euro35M or 7% or global revenue (whichover higher)
transparencyRequirements: Transparency for chatbots, deepfakes, and high-risk AI
enforcementAuthority: National Supervisory Authorities in EU Member States
regulatorySandbox: Encourages Member States to create sandboxes

name: ISO 42001
scope: General volutary standard for AI management systems
riskClassification: Risk-based framework as part of management system
